title: Atelier La Fresque du Climat
description:
Description

La Fresque du Climat est un atelier qui vise √† sensibiliser au changement climatique, permettant ainsi d'impulser des actions positives au niveau personnel et collectif. Con√ßu en France et bas√© sur le rapport du GIEC, il explique les causes et les cons√©quences du changement climatique.  Comment l‚Äôatelier fonctionne ?

 Cr√©ativit√© : D√©compresser, s‚Äôapproprier la fresque et cr√©er un esprit d‚Äô√©quipe en l‚Äôillustrant. Emotions : Accueillir des √©motions.

  Infos pratiques L'atelier se d√©roulant en ligne, une bonne connexion internet est n√©cessaire ! title: [WORKSHOP - ENGLISH - Online] New Narratives Collage
description:
>> NEW NARRATIVES COLLAGE WORKSHOP <<
    ‚ñ∫ IMPORTANT NOTE: This workshop takes place online and requires the use of online collaborative tools. It is imperative to ensure that you have a computer, a good internet connection, as well as a working microphone in order to be able to participate in the experience!
  ‚ñ∫ WORKSHOP INTENTIONS: The New Narratives Collage is a collaborative and learning experience that seeks to empower the pioneers of the transition (participants) by:
understanding the socio-cognitive obstacles to the necessary transition,
reconnecting to one‚Äôs creative power,
spreading new narratives in our societies.
  This experience contributes to the emergence of a future compatible with planetary boundaries and desirable for all.
 
How? By encouraging the adoption of sustainable behaviors through the imagination of new narratives.
  ‚ñ∫ WORKSHOP AGENDA:
15 min: ice breaker and introduction
1h15: theoretical understanding of our relationship to narratives,
1h30: of utopic fiction writing
  If you encounter any issues with your booking, contact us at workshops@fresquedesnouveauxrecits.org
  See you soon :)

title: OCEAN COLLAGE 27/11/2024 ONLINE FACILITATED BY JULIA B.
description:
Take part in a La Fresque Oc√©ane workshop to discover and better understand the marine ecosystem!
  Do you know which marine species is immortal? Where do green tides come from? What's the difference between longline fishing and trawling? What proportion of goods transported by sea?

Come and discover the "Fresque Oc√©ane", a fun, collaborative workshop that will give you a better overall understanding of the challenges facing the ocean, both in terms of threats and opportunities, and inspire you to take action, both individually and collectively!

Its fascinating biodiversity, its essential role in the climate machine, the extent of its many resources, but also the impact of our daily activities and actions will no longer hold any secrets for you.

Created by Alice Vitoux and inspired by "La Fresque du Climat", this workshop is open to everyone - citizens, local authorities, businesses and schools - and will immerse you in a collective underwater exploration.

For more information: www.fresqueoceane.org

description:

W√§hrend dieses Workshops werden Sie die Funktionsweise von √ñkosystemen, die Rolle der Biodiversit√§t f√ºr das Wohlbefinden der Menschheit, die Interaktionen mit menschlichen Aktivit√§ten und die Bedrohung durch ihre Erosion entdecken.

title: ONLINE Biodiversity Collage workshop (EN) - with B√©n√©dicte Herbout
description:
Workshop held in English

The Biodiversity Collage is a playful and cooperative workshop that aims to raise awareness around the stakes of biodiversity collapsing. During this workshop, you will discover the functioning of ecosystems, the part that Biodiversity plays for the Humanity well being, the interactions with human activities and the threat regarding its erosion.
This workshop will be held online using a videoconference tool (zoom) and a collaborative tool (MURAL). The participation to this workshop requires then a computer with a functioning microphone.
The connection info will be sent by email before the workshop.
  The participation to the workshop is under open pricing, starting from 10‚Ç¨. The collected amount will be used to finance the tools of the association "Fresque de la Biodiversit√©", actions to raise awareness as well as the development of the Fresque de la Biodiversit√© network.

title: ONLINE DIGITAL COLLAGE WORKSHOPS IN ITALIAN - Workshop online con Stefania Dante
description:
Il Digital Collage √® un workshop ludico e collaborativo.

L'obiettivo del workshop √® di sensibilizzare e formare i partecipanti sui problemi ambientali e sociali delle tecnologie digitali. Il workshop si propone anche di delineare soluzioni per una maggiore sostenibilit√† nelle tecnologie digitali e quindi ad aprire discussioni tra i partecipanti sull'argomento.
Il tuo biglietto non √® modificabile ed √® rimborsabile solo fino a 7 giorni prima del workshop. Ti preghiamo di assicurarti di poter davvero partecipare a questo evento, al fine di massimizzare l'intelligenza collettiva del gruppo. Grazie in anticipo.

Il prezzo della tua partecipazione √® libero e finanzier√† l'associazione "La Fresque du Num√©rique" (Il Digital Collage).
Ulteriori informazioni saranno inviate via e-mail ai partecipanti registrati qualche giorno prima del workshop.
  Per rispetto degli altri partecipanti, nessuno sar√† accettato se in ritardo di pi√π di 10 minuti.
  This event is bilingual : cards will be in English but conversations in Italian
  Your ticket is not modifiable and it is refundable only up to 7 days before the workshop. Would you please ensure you'll be really be able to attend this event, in order to maximize the group collective intelligence. Thanks in advance
  The Digital Collage is a playful and collaborative workshop. The aim of the workshop is to raise awareness and train participants on the environmental issues of digital technologies.
The workshop also aims to outline solutions for more sustainability in digital technologies, and then to open discussions among participants on the topic.
  The price of your participation is free with a minimum amount of 5‚Ç¨, it will finance the association "La Fresque du Num√©rique" (The Digital Collage).
  This session will take place online using a video conferencing tool and a visual collaboration tool. All technical information will be sent by email to registered participants a few days before the workshop. Out of respect for other participants, nobody will be accepted if more than 10 minutes late.

title: ASIA PACIFIC DIGITAL COLLAGE TRAININGS IN ENGLISH - Facilitation Training - In person Singapore
full_location: Online
description:
Please note that this facilitation training is intended for people :
- who have attended a Digital Collage workshop in the last 6 months
- who have already attended a Climate Fresk workshop (please contact us if you are unable to meet this requirement)

Your ticket is not modifiable and it is refundable only up to 7 days before the training. Would you please ensure you'll be really be able to attend this event, in order to maximize the group collective intelligence. Thanks in advance.

This training will allow you then to facilitate Digital Collage workshops in any non-commercial context under the Creative Commons BY-NC-ND license. In order to facilitate within a professional context, this will be soon available ; additional prerequisites will be required as well as the signature of a contract with the organisation. We will come back to this at the end of the training. 

This session will take place in person at the address indicated. Detailed information will be sent by email to registered participants a few days before the session. Out of respect for other participants, nobody will be accepted if more than 10 minutes late.
Once registered, your name, first name and email will be sent to the facilitator in charge of this session, in order to send you a briefing email before the session and another email after. This data will not then be kept by the association.

description:
Description de l‚Äôatelier
L‚Äôatelier de La Fresque de l‚ÄôAlimentation est un atelier ludique et p√©dagogique qui a pour objectif d‚Äôaccompagner les participant.e.s vers une alimentation plus durable et une prise de conscience des impacts de leur alimentation (environnement, biodiversit√©, sant√© et r√©silience territoriale).
L'atelier s'adapte et propose une version en ligne !
L‚Äôatelier s'inspire de La Fresque du Climat mais l'avoir d√©j√† fait, n'est pas un pr√©requis ! 
L‚Äôatelier est bas√© sur l‚Äôintelligence collective, l‚Äôanimateur.rice est l√† pour s‚Äôassurer du bon d√©roul√©, r√©pondre aux questions, ‚Ä¶ mais ce sont les participant.e.s qui pratiquent !
La partie R√©flexion se base sur 40 cartes r√©parties en 5 lots, √† placer en liant les causes et les cons√©quences entre elles via des fl√®ches
L‚Äôatelier pousse √† la prise d‚Äôactions (manger local, de saison, alimentation plus v√©g√©tale, ...)
L'atelier se base sur des sources scientifiques et reconnues (FAO, GIEC, ADEME, ...)
L'atelier s'adresse aux adultes de plus de 18 ans (une version junior est en cours de r√©flexion), experts ou novices sur le sujet, d√©j√† engag√©s ou non vers une alimentation plus durable, ... Bref, l'atelier s'adresse √† quiconque souhaite comprendre ce qu'il.elle mange ! Aucun pr√©requis n'est demand√© pour faire l'atelier !
D√©roul√©
L‚Äôatelier dure environ 3h et se d√©coupe en plusieurs √©tapes :
D√©marrage (30 min) : icebreaker, pr√©sentation des participant.e.s, de l‚Äôanimateur.rice, de l‚Äôatelier, ‚Ä¶
R√©flexion (1h15) : √©tude des causes et cons√©quences de nos consommations sur le climat, la biodiversit√©, la sant√© et la r√©silience alimentaire
Solutions (30 min) : quelles solutions pouvons-nous mettre en place d√®s maintenant √† notre √©chelle pour tendre vers une alimentation plus durable ? Quelles sont leurs cons√©quences ?
Actions (30 min) : choix d‚Äôune action individuelle et une action collective pour tendre vers une alimentation plus durable et anticipation des difficult√©s/freins qui pourraient √™tre rencontr√©s
D√©brief (15 min) : retours sur l‚Äôatelier, derniers conseils, quelle suite donner √† l‚Äôatelier, ...
Croyez-nous, √ßa passe (tr√®s) vite !
Infos pratiques
Mat√©riel
Vous aurez simplement besoin d‚Äôun ordinateur, d‚Äôun micro et d‚Äôune connexion internet suffisante pour pouvoir √©changer avec les autres participant.e.s. Si vous avez une souris √† molette c‚Äôest l‚Äôid√©al, sinon que √ßa soit avec le trackpad ou une souris classique, l‚Äôatelier peut se faire sans probl√®me !
Connexion √† la visio

title: [ONLINE] CONSTRUCTION COLLAGE WITH OLGA
description:
Construction Collage is a participatory workshop that breaks down how the construction and built environment industry affects the living world.
  During the workshop, you will :
In a small group, play out 45 game cards on the themes of urban planning, design, construction, and use of resources.
Find the cause and effect links between the different components of the industry by positioning and linking the cards.
Form a mind map to understand the big picture of the environmental and social issues of the construction industry.
Propose and discuss solutions.
  Duration
3h15. The time flies by, so please arrive 5 minutes early, we start sharp.
  Who is it for?
Everyone is concerned by climate change and biodiversity loss. Construction Collage was therefore designed for people with an interest in the construction sector, as well as for all construction professionals: the former will discover the subject and deconstruct their prejudices, while the latter will go deeper and question their practices.
  Make sure you have good internet connection and a laptop or a desktop to play from,  tablettes and phones will not work.  You willl find the a zoom link in your confirmation email.

title: WATER PUZZLE WORKSHOP (ENGLISH) - Water Puzzle Workshop ONLINE
description:
Fresque de l'eau
The Water Puzzle Workshop, online
Discover the issues related to water, its availability, its uses, and its sensitivity to climate change.
This workshop builds a global vision of the water cycle, thanks to a card game set up by the players according to 4 different sets:
- the natural water cycle,
- the anthropogenic water cycle (influenced by humans),
- the impacts of humans
- the impact of climate change on these cycles.
At the end, a discussion about individual and collective measures that can be taken is launched with the players. 
About the session
The link will be sent two days before the event, by mail. Check your spams ! The event is for individuals, maximum two persons by company. The session will occur with at least 4 players. Cancellations are refundable if they occur at least 48 hours before through your confirmation mail.
Tarifs : Pay as you want ! For Europe, classic price is 10 euros but you can support the association with a higher amount.

title: Textiles UnTangled : textiles impacts and solutions game workshop
description:
5 pm to 8 pm Stockholm time
Check here for the time in your location
  Facilitator : Andreia OLARU
  Textiles are everywhere! In our clothing, furniture, toys and even computers! But how much do you really know about them? What exactly are our textiles made from? How sustainable are they, really? How far do our clothes travel before we buy them? Where do they go once they are donated?
  This collaborative workshop illustrates the complexities and impacts (social and ecological) of the textile industry by using clothing as a case study. You will create the production chain of textiles, learn about the industry‚Äôs impact, and then work together to find solutions and actions you can take.
  This workshop is inspired by the pedagogy of the Climate Fresk (an interactive workshop that teaches the IPCC Climate report). Experience this unique way of learning, if you are new to the Fresk universe of workshops. Launched in 2021, Textiles UnTangled has been enjoyed by over 600 participants.
  You will learn:
  1. Materials 101 - What fabrics should I choose!?!
2. The life cycle of textiles, from raw materials to end of life
3. Textile industry impacts on the planet and on humans.
4. How to think critically of claims made by companies & organizations about their sustainability
5. Notions of circular economy, systems view thinking, and human centered solutions
6. Actions that can be taken on a collective, business, and individual level
All while working together and having fun!
  Our main sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation, Preferred Textiles Report, OXFAM, Fashion Revolution and ADEME.
  What participants have said:
  "This game is a fun, civic-minded and inclusive way to think about our relationship to clothing. I highly recommend it!" - Anonymous
  "I learned valuable information about the choices one can make to minimize one's impact of GHGs and other pollutants when consuming textiles, whether it be clothing, furniture or other textile products." - Alex
  A nice workshop to better understand the impacts of the textile industry with lots of mini games. Fun and interesting, for everyone, I love it! - Sylvaine
  Thank you to them and all our participants! We have a 4.4 / 5 satisfaction rate!
  Who is this for?
  All expertise levels welcome! From people who wear clothing (haha) to textile producers! Textiles are everywhere and concern everyone. Experts in the field also enjoy this workshop and its ability to give a holistic view of the industry, spark discussion, and capacity-build in their organizations. Some companies who have played: Vestiaire Collective, Deloitte, Givenchy, Promod, Caroll and Minelli, Balzac, and Electrolux. For a private session you can contact: greendonut.info@gmail.com
  Who is this by?
  Textiles UnTangled game workshop (Textile Collage) was created by the volunteers at Green Donut. Created in France in 2019, Green Donut is an association whose mission is to promote the donut economics model by Kate Raworth (a society prospering within environmental and social limits) via their serious games and actions in the community. They are professionals, experts and concerned citizens of many backgrounds. While based in France, they have diverse backgrounds and welcome members from other countries.
  Their website (in french only for now) with all their events including our Fresque de D√©chets (Waste Collage = French only): http://greendonut.org
  Commitment and Cancellation
  This workshop is a small group workshop (max 8 participants) that needs a minimum to fully capitalise on our collective intelligence. If you must cancel, please do so a week before. Request a refund via Billetweb and it will be granted, minus the Evenbrite fees. If cancelled within a week, please let us know. You are welcome to transfer the ticket to someone else. You can notify us at greendonut.info@gmail.com. Thanks in advance.
    Now let‚Äôs learn about textiles to change the world together!

title: [Online] Climate puzzle workshop - with Emilie PONS
description:
Your ticket cannot be changed and is only refundable up to seven days before the workshop. Please register only if you are sure you will be able to attend, so as not to block the space for others.
  This citizen workshop is intended for individuals. Professional participants are only accepted on a trial basis, with a maximum of one representative from the same company per workshop and 3 representatives from the same company for all citizen workshops combined. For more information on workshops for professionals, visit https://puzzleclimat.org.
This citizens' workshop is run voluntarily. Participation is free, with a minimum charge of 10 euros to fund the Puzzle climat (PSI Climat) association.

What is a free price? It's a fair estimate of what you can afford, your personal situation and the value of the time, materials and work required by the facilitator and the association to run the workshop. It's a principle of trust and fairness that enables us to build a fairer and more caring society. So please consider taking part in good conscience. These financial contributions help the association to develop and reach out to more people.

This session will take place remotely.
A connection link will be sent to you later.
  Detailed information will be emailed to registered participants a few days before the workshop. Out of respect for others and timing, participants who are more than ten minutes late will not be accepted.

Once you have registered, your first name, surname and email address will be forwarded to the facilitator in charge of the session, who will send you a briefing email before the session and another email afterwards.

The Climate Puzzle (Individual Climate Solutions Jigsaw) is a VERY fun ‚Äòserious game‚Äô that will give you a detailed picture of the French situation in terms of greenhouse gas emissions and will also give you the keys to effective action to halve the average French carbon footprint in five years without going back to the oil lamp!
    This workshop was created by Benoit Marienval, Thierry Sidofil and Aur√©lien D√©ragne. A project team of 10 contributors is involved in its development.
  puzzleclimat.org
Puzzle Climat
